content.description: This is the tallest route on the wall.  More-or-less vertical face climbing with an interesting bulge and tricky section near the chains.
content.location: 2nd route from the left.  Climbs in the center of the wall protected by large roofs above.

content.description: Climbs the face just left of the corner.  Follows hard to see camouflaged glue in bolts.  The corner is not part of the route and best avoided because it was never cleaned.
content.protection: Stick clip. Chains with steel biners.
content.location: 4th route from the left.  Just left of a shallow/chossy corner.

content.description: Furthest left route on the Bumper Wall.   Good idea to stick clip, as there are slopers and it is Maple cobbles.
content.location: Furthest left route on Bumper Wall.  Between the two trees.

content.description: More fun cobbles, with plenty that slope when you are hoping they will sink down in.  Named after the countless Sundays enjoyed at Maple.  Like all the routes at the Bumper Wall, this has 1/2" stainless bolts.

Sure, its short, but Gordon climbs really fun and is a worthy route whether it be a warm up before headed up canyon or a less intimidating project for the aspiring 5.11 leader.  This route and the one to the right are named after Gordon and Mindy -  fixtures of SLC climbing achievement and often seen in Maple Canyon.  Begins on some big & easy cobbles down & left of the first bolt and stays relatively sustained to the chains.
content.location: Locate the "normal" non-glue in 1st bolt in a large cobble.  The other bolts on the route are glue ins.  Shorter, but steeper than the routes to the left.

content.description: Quality climbing with a tricky finish on thin holds.  Great moves on solid rock.  Named after Mindy Shulak and Gordon Douglass and their years of involvement in the Utah climbing scene.
content.protection: Always best to stick clip.  6 glue-in stainless bolts to chains with steel lower off biners
content.location: Currently the furthest right route on the Bumper Wall.   Pulls a bulge at the 2nd bolt and stays left of the black rock until the last bolt where it crests out right to the chains.
